page.title: 01May Day
page.content: In the morning we go out to get flowers for May Day.We mostly get bluebells and red campion.We get our Headteacher's chair and decorate it with flowers and greenery for our May Queen's throne. We get the shoe lockers to decorate with a symmetrical pattern for a dais. The infants pull the petals off their flowers and put them in baskets. Then we put the chairs out on the Green for people who want to see us. Rachel,my friend,was the May Queen this year and I was the May Queen last year. James and Alexis, the May Queen's guards,were making their staffs. They had a stick each and they put some wire-netting securely around the top of the sticks.Then they put some flowers in to make it look attractive. We also get some flowers from the Tresco Abbey Gardens. Some children
